O'Brien agrees late night's future seems murky. I don't think anybody knows, O'Brien tells PopcornBiz. "We don't know if late night shows are going to be a pill that you take in three years or a saline drop that goes in your eye. None of us knows.

composer Jonathan Elias admits he won permission to use Jim Morrison 's recording from The Doors' legend's estate after calling on the group's producer Paul Rothchild to help him seek out the rare track. He says, I went to the family through their attorneys and told them about this project, and they agreed to license it. Being a Jim Morrison fan, I was pretty excited about it. 's Azure cloud unit, will be leaving, CEO Steve Ballmer said in an e-mail to employees Wednesday. CEO Mike Zafirovski articulates the company assets but says it was overly complex to make decisions and assign accountability. Windows Azure is in a great place, and Amitabh Srivastava is ready to move to a new phase in his career. He has done stellar work for the company and I will work to ensure a smooth transition with the Windows Azure team, said Steve Ballmer . It's thought that Amitabh Srivastava 's exit is connected to Microsoft's announcement that company veteran Satya Nadella would replace Bob Muglia as head of Server and Tools. playoffs since 2006 and has never won a postseason game. The Grizzlies are coming off a 24-58 season that tied for fifth-worst in the NBA. "This year for me is so personal," Allen Iverson said. It's basically going to be my rookie season again. It hurts, but I turn the TV on, I read the paper, I listen to some of the things people say about me having the season that I had last year and me losing a step, things like that. They're trying to put me in a rocking chair already. The Grizzlies announced they had signed the 10-time All Star on Thursday morning minutes before Allen Iverson was introduced at a news conference.
